CRUNCH: A noisy crackling sound; the sound usually associated with ______ing.
HOOK: A rod bent into a curved shape, typically with one end free and the other end secured to a rope or other attachment.
KANGAROO: A member of the Macropodidae family of large marsupials with strong hind legs for hopping, native to Australia.
OBVIOUS: Easily discovered, seen, or understood; self-explanatory.
PLANET: Each of the seven major bodies which move relative to the fixed stars in the night sky—the Moon, Mercury, Venus, the Sun, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn.
UNDERPANTS: Underwear covering the genitalia and often buttocks, usually going no higher than the navel.
